avdta.network.node

Class PhasedTBR

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.IntersectionControl
      • avdta.network.node.TBR
        • avdta.network.node.PriorityTBR
          • avdta.network.node.PhasedTBR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Signalized

    public class PhasedTBR
extends PriorityTBR
implements Signalized
    This is a version of reservations in which vehicles with a green light get priority. Other vehicles can still move if capacity is available.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class avdta.network.node.TBR

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhasedTBR

        public PhasedTBR()
        Constructs this PhasedTBR with empty Phases for a null Intersection. A non-null Intersection is required for simulation.

      • PhasedTBR

        public PhasedTBR(Intersection n)
        Constructs this PhasedTBR with empty Phases for the specified Intersection
        Parameters:
        n - the Intersection this PhasedTBR controls

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this PhasedTBR to restart simulation. This resets the current phase to start at the offset.
        Overrides:

      • addPhase

        public void addPhase(Phase p)
        Adds a Phase to the cycle. Phases do not need to be added in sequence order.

        public double getDuration()

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes this PhasedTBR after the network is read. The list of Phases is sorted according to sequence, and the current Phase is set based on the offset.
        Overrides:
        initialize in class TBR
        See Also:
        ConflictFactory

      • calcGreenTime

        public void calcGreenTime()
        Calculates the green time for the current time step, and updates the capacity for each PhaseMovement
        See Also:
        PhaseMovement

      • reserveCapacity

        public boolean reserveCapacity(Vehicle v)
        Attempts to reserve capacity for the specified Vehicle. This relies on Vehicle.getPrevLink() being an incoming Link, and Vehicle.getNextLink() being an outgoing Link.
        Parameters:
        v - the vehicle reserving capacity
        Returns:
        whether the reservation was successful

      • step

        public int step()
        Executes one time step of simulation Vehicles that do not have a next Link (some buses) are removed from the network. Vehicles that move are removed from their previous Link (Link.removeVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle) and added to their next Link (Link.addVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle)). This requires that Vehicle.getPrevLink() is the incoming Link and Vehicle.getNextLink() is the outgoing Link. * Human-driven vehicles traveling through a reservation must reserve all possible turning movements.
        Overrides:
        step in class PriorityTBR
        Returns:
        the number of exiting vehicles
